alert.note: Alert for Des Moines; Lee (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 06 at 2:42AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM CDT THIS MORNING THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of west central Illinois, southeast Iowa and northeast Missouri, including the following counties, in west central Illinois, Hancock, Henderson, McDonough and Warren. In southeast Iowa, Des Moines and Lee. In northeast Missouri, Clark and Scotland. * WHEN...From 6 AM CDT Sunday through late Sunday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Occasional rounds of showers and thunderstorms are forecast from early this morning into late tonight. Recent heavy rainfall has led to saturated ground and there is potential for peak rain rates between 1 to 2 inches per hour. Total rainfall will vary across the region, ranging between 1 and 3 inches with isolated higher amounts possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
